jobText: TXT/50608545.txt	§Sales Associate§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sales Associate§§Advertiser: §Bonz Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Queenstown & Wanaka§§Salary§§$40,000 - $59,999 base (negotiable) + commission§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Retail & Consumer Products§, §Retail Assistants§§§§§§Established in 1985, BONZ manufactures and retails luxury New Zealand made apparel, accessories and home goods. We are best known for creating elevated and opulent garments from rare and high-quality materials, most notably Slinkskin (ethical baby lamb) and Possum. Our collections are inspired by the brand's Queenstown origins and embody a feeling of luxury and high society. BONZ products are sold in our flagship Queenstown retail store, through selected global luxury retailers, and on our e-commerce store - www.bonz.com. §  § §  §BONZ is seeking a dynamic, customer service driven Sales Associate for our Queenstown Store§  §As a Sales Associate at BONZ, you will be a brand ambassador responsible for generating sales and building customer relationships in our retail stores. You will demonstrate a high degree of proficiency in interacting with the customers, identify their needs, and being able to maximize sales opportunities. You will be responsible for continuing the client contact beyond the initial sale by capturing name, address, phone and email contact information, and using multiple means to communicate and build ongoing relationships. You will also be responsible for maintaining the visual and housekeeping standards of the store including presentation of the selling floors, receiving of merchandise, and processing of markdowns.§  §Responsibilities§ § §Achieve and exceed the personal sales and productivity goals agreed upon with the store manager§ §Demonstrate a complete knowledge of the merchandises' features and benefits to maximize the sales opportunity§ §Be a quick thinker who listens to the customer and can identify his/her needs and overcome objections if raised§ §Responsible to do client development beyond the initial transaction; utilizing phone, email and written follow-up contact§ §Maintain the housekeeping and visual standards of the store§ §Have computer skills to operate the POS register and email systems§ §Qualifications§ § §One or more years of selling or customer service experience, preferably in Luxury retail§ §Must be a sales-driven, goal-oriented individual§ §Must have a positive, high-energy, friendly, outgoing and engaging personality.§ §Must be willing to take the first step to initiate contact with the customers and identify their shopping needs.§ §Must demonstrate strong verbal and written communication skills allowing for effective communication with your customers§ §Must possess computer skills to operate our retail POS system, Word, Excel and email§ § §  §Compensation§  §The successful candidate will enjoy a competitive compensation package which may include short and/or long term incentives and merchandise discount.§  § §  § §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

Manager.§Key Responsibilities:§Manage the assigned area, with respect to resources and ensure the area operates effectively and in line with Storelink processes and procedures.§Oversee the recruitment, selection, training, performance and development of merchandisers and Senior Merchandisers within the territory.      Experience in management of contractors’ vs employees is desirable. §Maintain contact with key clients’ representatives, retail store management and internal stakeholders.§Act as the key contact between Storelink, our clients and the merchandisers in the assigned territory.§Ensure all merchandisers in the field complete all tasks accurately and in a timely manner.   §Responsible for ensuring information in our online system is accurate & all tasks are completed according to company guidelines.§Management of any issues in the field promptly with a view to treat issues as opportunities to review / amend current operating procedures.§Influence decisions at store level with respect to discretionary space allocation to maximise our clients’ sales opportunities. §Ensure Storelink and retailer Health & Safety policies and procures are adhered to at all times.§To provide short term cover as required for Merchandisers§To be considered for the role you will need to demonstrate:§A thorough understanding of the retail environment with a strong emphasis on Foodstuffs & Woolworths New Zealand§Motivated team leader with strong people management skills (ideally experience in managing contractors)§Experienced in recruitment and training§Organized with a “can-do” attitude.  Ability to handle multiple tasks at any one time is essential as we represent multiple brands in multiple retail outlets§Self-motivated with the desire to drive a team to exceed client expectations and maximise customer satisfaction§Customer centric, result driven individual §Experience in scheduling / allocation of tasks§Good written and verbal communication skills §A great work ethic, sense of humour, resilience and proficient in priority planning.§Computer literate §As some of our work is done when consumers aren’t in store, early morning starts, and flexibility are essential in this role.§The position is full time (30 hours/ week) and comes with a competitive salary package, car allowance and tools of trade.  If this sounds like you, please apply with a cover letter and CV outlining your relevant experience.  Only applicants with relevant experience will be considered for this role.§What Now:§ §Applications close 5pm Thursday 8th, October 2020, or sooner if the role is placed before this date. Initial screening interviews may be conducted via Microsoft Teams or Zoom.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have customer service experience?§How many years' experience do you have in the retail industry?§How many years of recruitment experience do you have?§How far are you willing to travel for work?§§§

jobText: TXT/50638775.txt	§Spark Representative - Whanganui§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Spark Representative - Whanganui§§Advertiser: §Spark New Zealand Trading Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Wanganui§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Retail & Consumer Products§, §Retail Assistants§§§§§§At Spark we're proud of helping of all New Zealand win big in a digital world. As part of fulfilling our purpose, we are embarking on a journey and a new way of working called Unified Frontline, with the overarching ambition that our people are unified in their customer obsession and can provide a consistent customer experience across all ways that we interact with our customers.§This is where you come in! We are on the lookout for an amazing individual to join us on this journey.§As a Spark Representative, I am someone who:§Is truly customer obsessed by putting them at the centre of everything we do.§Loves a variety of work and strives for continuous development.§Has a passion for working day-to-day within a team that thrives off sharing knowledge and expertise (to support a culture of continuous learning, where you learn from others and they learn from you).§Exuding passion and energy to foster enthusiasm among the team in bringing Unified Frontline's vision to life.§Is adaptable and flexible to changes as we evolve through Unified Frontline, as a team and as a business.§What will this look like for you?§-When you join Spark, we will kickstart your career with us by upskilling you in what we call the 'universal skillset' which is will provide you with the foundation of knowledge and skills to interact with a customer regardless of how they choose to get in touch with us. From there, you will be able to learn on the job, and apply your learnings to what we refer to as a 'touchpoint' (the way we interact with our customers) such as retail or contact centre.§-You will start with one form of interacting with a customer. However, the amazing thing is, once you build your confidence and hunger for development, you will be able to move onto another touchpoint.§-The team you will work with is made up of customer obsessed people who are also self-driving their own learning. This means that while showing up for our customers consistently, and you can lean on your team members to support you to ensure you can provide that end to end customer service.§This will mean that we can provide our customers with world class service by flowing to where the customer needs us, through the channel of their choice. This will further your sales career giving you incredible opportunities to grow and develop your career and skillset with us.§At Spark,§ we are a 7 day a week business with a very diverse customer base so there is a need for flexibility and embracing what it takes to support our people and customers. With that, there will be a need at times to be adaptable in terms of working across different Spark locations and different rosters/schedules.§If you have previous customer service or sales experience, love technology, thrive in a fast pace environment, and can connect with a diverse range of people, you could be just the person we are looking for.§Not only are we customer inspired but we're also about making you feel at valued and appreciated. That is why we have put in place a competitive salary and commission, and generous staff benefits.§Feel like being world class? We need people like you to make it happen, apply today.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

In this position you will be required to fulfill a variety of different tasks including:§ §* Filling online orders and making phone calls to customers for that extra bit of customer service.§* Processing customer payments using the shop's Point of Sale (POS) system in a professional and friendly manner (this is a very important aspect of this role and something we pride ourselves in at Biltong Plus).§* Placing orders with suppliers§* 'Tumbling' Biltong Meat§* Receiving, processing, and organizing shipments and deliveries accordingly.§* Rotating stock according to best by dates (be sure to mention if you have experience in this!)§* Making Coffee and Warm food§* Baking Tarts and making crusts§* Restocking depleted or low shop items and ensuring that the sales floor is well organized and tidy  §* Assisting customers in locating desired shop items.§* Informing customers of shop promotions to encourage purchases.§* Performing regular price audits to identify and correct price discrepancies.§* Although we have a cleaner, some day to day cleaning will be required.§* Addressing and resolving customer complaints in a professional manner. PLEASE DO NOT APPLY FOR THE JOB IF THIS LOCATION DOES NOT WORK FOR YOU. We hope to fill this position immediately so all applications welcome.§ §Hours:§Hours will be discussed during the interview process. We will initially look at 40-80 hours per fortnight. Work will be according to a fortnightly roster.  Alternating weekends on duty; non-negotiable. Shop hours are 8am to 6pm so must be available during those hours.§ §To be successful as a Shop Assistant, you should be well-organized and adept at using pricing and labeling equipment. Ultimately, an outstanding Shop Assistant should demonstrate effective communication skills and achieve exceptional customer service at all times. You should also be able to identify customers' needs and recommend suitable shop items that best satisfy their needs. You must be able to work on your own, fulfilling tasks given by the manager or owner as well as taking initiative to go the extra mile.§You MUST be eligible to work in NZ.§If this sounds like you, we look forward to receiving your application. All questions are welcome so please contact us should you have any.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a sales assistant?§Do you have customer service experience?§What is the maximum weight that you are comfortable and able to lift?§§§

jobText: TXT/50652662.txt	§Retail Assistants! Want more than what's in store?§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Retail Assistants! Want more than what's in store?§§Advertiser: §Atlas and Arrow Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Retail & Consumer Products§, §Retail Assistants§§§§§§We think this little pearl of wisdom sums up 2020 pretty well..§ §“Tough times don’t define you, they refine you”§ §Some of the world’s biggest brands; Uber, Whatsapp, Air Bnb, instagram were launched on the back of the 2008 Global Financial Crisis. They saw an opportunity where others saw challenges. We're not in their ball-park just yet, but we reckon they might have have been on to something!§ §Right now, the demand for a cost-effective sales and marketing strategy and a personal connection with customers during turbulent economic times means we have an opportunity for growth!§ §We have a pretty funky, tight-knit team. Its small, but they tell us it’s not the size of the team it’s what you do with it! We’ve used lockdown to refine and pivot as a business. We’ve relaunched our face-to-face sales and promotional teams to connect client’s brands to customers. We’re not getting too far ahead of ourselves, but we think we've got the hang of it.§ §So needless to say, we’re not looking at sitting at home for the rest of this year. We figure if you’re looking for work right now, neither are you!§ §We’re looking for a couple of fresh faces to work personally with our Managing Director Phil over the next month. His jokes are terrible, but we think he’s a bit of a legend!§ §You'll have access to product training, coaching workshops and a personal mentor. With sales assignments at retail promotions and pop-up retail kiosks available 7 days a week you can fill your boots and work as many days you can squeeze in, ‘the more the merrier’ they say. This gives you the best possible crack at the uncapped commissions, incentives and growth opportunities.§ §You don’t need to be a Marketing or Sales expert, but you’ll need to be willing to step outside your comfort zone. If you’ve got a bit of personality and you’re keen to learn you might be just who we’re after…§ §If you’d like to get to know us better, chuck Atlas & Arrow a like or a follow on the socials or hit the APPLY button NOW§ §https://www.instagram.com/atlasandarrow.co.nz/§ §Successful applicants will be contacted this week§§§§

jobTitle: Fixed Term Summer Merchandiser! Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50653545.txt	§Fixed Term Summer Merchandiser!§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Fixed Term Summer Merchandiser!§§Advertiser: §Coca-Cola Amatil NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Retail & Consumer Products§, §Merchandisers§§§§§§Fixed-Term Summer Merchandiser Opportunity§Your Impact§ §We are seeking a motivated and hardworking  §Fixed-Term Summer Merchandiser §to support our “On the Go” sales team looking after the West & North areas.§ §Focusing on our Summer Hotspot Areas you will ensure our iconic brands are well-stocked and displayed, making them easily accessible to our customers! You’ll be building displays, filling shelves and coolers, and making our products look fantastic out in market! §This role reports remotely into a Sales Manager and connects regularly with the local Sales rep. This is an incredibly physical role where you'll be required to lift cases of product off pallets and arrange them on display stands in store, so you'll have plenty of opportunities to stay fit.§ §The shift patterns available are:§ § § §30 hours per week §  § §About You§ §We’re looking for honest and reliable team members, who are driven to do a great job. You’ll bring an eye for detail and ensure our products stand out against our competitors - because you’re proud of our products and they way they bring moments of happiness every day to our customers!§ §You may have previous Merchandising experience, or this could be your entry point into a career with an award-winning FMCG company, as these roles frequently lead to opportunities within our Sales teams. You will also need:§ § § §Access to your own vehicle, and hold a current driver’s license§ §To be available for early morning or evening shifts.§ § § §Here at CCANZ we have a Zero Harm Policy, so because we care about your safety you will need to be able to lift approx. 18kgs with ease.§ § § §The Benefits:§Join a fun and flexible team and learn how to connect with our customers. In addition to an hourly rate, we provide an awesome company culture and a learning environment that is committed to developing our people and supporting them to reach new possibilities. These roles can lead to ongoing opportunities within our Sales teams. Bring a strong customer focus and we'll provide you with the tools and training you need to be a successful part of the Amatil family. We look for Merchandisers all over New Zealand, and seek to find people who share our mission of creating millions of moments of happiness and possibilities.§Coca-Cola Amatil NZ is one of the largest leading manufacturers and distributors of ready-to-drink beverages, including non-alcoholic, alcoholic beverages, and coffee. We're exceptionally proud to be recognised as one of NZ's Best Employers four years in a row! If you ask our team what they love about working here, they'll tell you it's our people, our brands, and our culture. Our vision and values are at the heart of everything we do, and we are committed to creating millions of moments of happiness and possibilities for our employees. Bring the real you and be part of a culture where we embrace equal opportunities and celebrate diversity. In-store and on the road; get your innovative ideas launched§ §Great opportunity to stamp your success across 3 retail shops§ §Make a real difference in the lives of others§ § § §Sounds good – then let us be a part of your next chapter!§ §If you:§ § §Are an experienced leader from the Retail Industry, who knows that a Retail Charity Shop needs to deliver an exceptional shopping experience tailored to the needs of the shop's community and unique customer profile.§ §Have a focus on teamwork, great shop layout, fabulous stock and great organisational systems that ensure a seamless customer experience.§ §Will always be striving to deliver increased profits – to Make Hospice Happen in your community.§ § § §Then we want to hear from you now!§ § § §Our Purpose…§ §Totara Hospice's vision is to honour living and dignify dying. Doing this by providing leading edge hospice palliative care services to eligible individuals travelling the journey of a terminal illness. Ensuring that patients and their whānau are able to focus on living every moment, we have the shared belief that living well and dying well are fundamental values within a compassionate and caring community.§ § § §Hospice Retail Charity Chain Shop Supervisor opportunity…§ §This is a great time to join the team at Totara Hospice as we support a new and exciting journey for our five Hospice Charity shops. These shops are home to an eclectic assortment of donated products and raise valuable funds to support our work in the community.§ §As Shop Supervisor, you will combine commercial acumen with creativity, leading a team of employees and volunteers to deliver the highest standards of customer service and presentation in order to maximise income for Totara Hospice. Are you up for the challenge to take the opportunity to manage up to 3 x successful stores, market and promote them within the community, and build an exceptional team that are committed to raising funds?§ § § §Have you got what it takes?§ §As you know, being in retail is demanding but the people you work alongside make it much more than just a job. You will be passionate about teamwork and engaging your staff and volunteers and thrive off the hustle and bustle of our busy shops.§ §Some of the activities you will engage with daily:§ §Manage all aspects of your shops§: §This may include using innovative display techniques to increase your sales, relationship building in your community to increase stock generation, reviewing suitability of incoming donations and anything else required to ensure the day to day operational success of the shops.§ §Leading your shop teams§:§ You will lead, inspire and engage a multi-disciplined team of both paid employees and volunteers. Our people are the key to our success; you will grow them with us.§ §Business Development§:§ We think big, and we like our people to do the same. You will have targets to ensure we grow, reporting structures, and accountability for performance. In addition, you will play an active part in the community and engage with customers and donors so that we become everyone's first choice when shopping or donating items.§ §However, always customer service and exceeding targets will be at the forefront of your mind, along with:§ § §A passion to work with volunteers, enjoy welcoming new volunteers, coaching, and developing them into your existing team.§ §From your retail sector background you will have substantial retailing knowledge, having multi-site management would be an advantage. Plus, you'll have strong commercial awareness with a track record of increasing and sustaining sales.§ §You must also have experience of using digital administrative systems and procedures, databases and spreadsheets and prioritising your workloads to deadlines.§ §As our region in §South Auckland is a melting pot of ethnicities and cultures. Our workforce reflects that beautiful tapestry and you will embrace that we promote diversity and inclusion, ensuring all customers, donors, staff and volunteers enjoy cultural safety and celebration of difference.§  § §Great interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate with a diverse range of people, resolve problems and the ability to think on your feet§ § § §Are we right for you?§ §Are you looking for a rotational roster that will give you some weekend days off, and no evening openings? Are you keen to work in an organisation that supports people to develop and grow, providing job-specific training as well as soft skills training? Ready to now take your love for retail to do good in your community?§ § § §Sounds like the perfect match?§ §For this position it is essential that you have demonstrative retail experience, either as an existing leader or know you are ready to step up into your next exciting retail career chapter.§ § § §If you love delivering exceptional customer service, and can inspire a team with positive, results driven, motivation we want to hear from you! applications close 31st October 2020§ § § §PS: Hospice Shops provide a second life for items that would normally end up in landfill site. The Personal Shopper needs to ensure all tasks are efficiently and accurately completed in a timely, professional manner. § §We are looking for someone who can ensure: §Operational excellence is achieved for all online shopping orders §Items picked, packed, processed and invoiced for a customer’s order is completed accurately and efficiently by adhering to standard operating procedures and ensuring that best practice guidelines for best before/use-by dates, weighted items, restricted items and substitutions are followed §Orders are labelled and checked, stored securely, recorded and temperature checked in accordance with online store policies and operational procedures within a timely manner. §Lockers are empty and clean after each allocated timeslot, where necessary returning uncollected orders to the appropriate storage areas within the staging area. §All restricted goods that customers are collecting from the lockers are in accordance with ID checking procedures and policies. §Housekeeping/cleaning responsibilities and schedules for the staging area, lockers, online equipment and vehicles are maintained and adhered to. § §This role will involve building positive relationships and regular communication with customers to advise them of any information which is relevant to their order. § §THE SUCCESFUL APPLICANT WILL: §§Have good command of written and spoken English §Have fantastic customer service experience §Have good basic Maths skills §Have good computer skills §Be flexible and driven with strong work ethic and an excellent attitude §Be responsible for working individually and taking sole ownership of orders §Have the ability to prioritise and multitask consistently to meet strict deadlines for order  completion §Be physically fit and able to fulfil all the requirements of the role § §Days and Hours § §Sun & Mon  6am – 4pm § § §  §Applications close 18 Oct 2020 unless filled earlier§§§§

The Company’s apparel and footwear brands represent a casual lifestyle for young‐minded people who are inspired by a passion for outdoor action sports. The Company’s Quiksilver, Billabong, Roxy, DC Shoes, RVCA, Element, VonZipper, Kustom and Palmers brands have authentic roots and heritage in surf, snow and skate.§  § §  §APPLY TODAY§  §Apply below to kick start your next career move!§  §Thank you for your interest in working with us. Whilst we would love the chance to speak to each and every applicant unfortunately that's not always possible. If you have been selected for an interview you will hear back from us within 3 weeks. Good luck!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a store manager?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50689909.txt	§Trainee Manager - Golf Warehouse Dunedin§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Trainee Manager - Golf Warehouse Dunedin§§Advertiser: §Golf Warehouse Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Salary§§$45,000 - $60,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Retail & Consumer Products§, §Management - Store§§§§§§About the business§ §Our business is a family based business, that has grown in 25 years from one driving range into now three driving ranges and ten Superstore shops nationwide. We have an approximate 50% market share in NZ and growing, which we are very proud of and need people like you to take us to the next level. We cater for the beginner right through to a professional, literally, all training can be done on site. We like to promote our staff up through our ranks and there are endless opportunities available, from managing your own store, to starting a professional apprenticeship with the NZPGA ( New Zealand professional Golfer's Association).§ §About the role§ §A Trainee Manager is someone who can start in our business (from scratch if need be) and learn on site ALL the skills required to run their OWN business or OURS. § §Merchandising, Retail Sales, Customer Service, Inwards and Outwards goods, Online Sales, are just some of the things taught and required in any successful business.§ §The Dunedin store is one of newest and one of our best! The store is well organised and the people you serve generally get to know you by name. Golf Warehouse continually sources the best equipment from leading brands. You get to help customers improve their games by using the best technology (simulators) on the market and introducing equipment to customers in a less saturated market.§ §Golf in Otago is booming at the moment and we want you to be part of that growth. Repeat business and great deals are important to us.§ §You will work alongside like-minded people who are keen to see you, and themselves grow. Our team is enthusiastic and young. The focus is on making time at work FUN. The music will be on and ‘cranked up’ and we aim to offer an unmatched golf retail experience.§ §Benefits and perks§ §Golf is our business, with good salaries, parking, equipment and even overseas trips all available for the right applicant who is keen to learn and grow in our business.  § §Dunedin is a smaller city which means usually no more than a 15 minute drive to get anywhere. Traffic is considerably less here than elsewhere in NZ and there are some amazing golf courses nearby. § §Balmacewen GC is the oldest course in the southern hemisphere. Chisholm Park GC and St Clair GC along with another 15 courses are within 1 hours drive. Not to mention NZ's adventure capital Queenstown not far way.§ §Skills and experience§ §Golf is our business, we need someone who is bubbly and friendly, who is willing to learn, and wants to be successful in their chosen career, who is not afraid of hard work, and wants to learn GOLF on the way.§ §You don't have to be a low handicap golfer or be a professional to do well in our business but you do have to have passion and some experience playing or being around the game will go a long way.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§Do you have customer service experience?§How many years of retail management experience do you have?§§§
